availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George William Sulser (Maysville, Kentucky, wagon maker)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, wagon maker. Virginia native. Married to Mary Sulser. Father of George W. Sulser and Mary E. Sulser. Wagon maker in Maysville in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason, Maysville, District 2, p. 108B.
“George William Sulser: Death Last Night of This Amiable Man and Good Citizen,” The Daily Public Ledger (Maysville, Ky.), August 9, 1901, p. 1.
